title: Eddie Jones: I have been in a typhoon - it was right to call England v France off
text:
Eddie Jones has revealed he was almost seriously injured by a typhoon in Japan and praised the organisers’ decision to cancel England’s game against France.​

The head coach said the “typhoon gods” had been smiling on his squad as cancelling the match handed his players a two-week preparation for their quarter-final in Oita.​

He also insisted that Scotland would have only themselves to blame if they were knocked out by their match against Japan being cancelled, given there was always a risk of such an eventuality.​

Jones, who was Japan head coach for four years and also coached club rugby here for many years, knows first hand about the potential dangers of typhoons to life.​
